page.title: 16SOUTH SHIELDS-GAMES/DIALECT
page.content: {Games and Dialect.} When we go out to play, we play football,{'Kingy'}or cricket.If there are enough of us we play'Cat & Mouse',{'Blocker'}(hide and seek) or football.When we have enough time we go down to Conways bike shop and have a look at the BMX and racer bikes. On Saturday mornings we go swimming at the new{Leisure Centre} or Derby Street Baths. We also use some words in our playing that children from other places might not know.'Skinch' for instance means you can't be caught and when we're running around someone might shout "don't {coin} or you'll {dunch}" "don't turn round or you'll bump" Also, if you don't want to be the blocker in hide and seek, you shout"bags no man".
